code: If some mistake that breaks questionnaire generation is present in the raw questionnaire, like a syntax error in embedded R code for example, an error is thrown and the progress output stops, allowing to easily locate the source position of the mistake:  ```{r, echo = FALSE} fs::path_package("asciicasts/gen_qstnr_tibble-failed.json",                  package = "fokus") %>%   asciicast::read_cast() %>%   # playback speed is not stored in the asciicast itself, so has to be set here   asciicast::asciinema_player(speed = 0.75) ```  As one can see from the output above, the error occurred when processing key `variable_label`, and from further above we can see that the key belongs to the item `first_name` which in turn is defined under branch path `00_cantonal_statistical_office.002_to_polling_agency`. Error: 'raw_qstnr' is not an exported object from 'namespace:fokus'

title: FOKUS questionnaire schema
text: raw questionnaire written TOML file format. Basically, questionnaire items defined ordered tree structure child nodes inherit attributes parent (transitively grandparent etc.) nodes. following main semantic rules apply: Top table level (blockname) defines questionnaire block1, whereby (alphabetical) order table levels conforms order blocks questionnaire: Lower table level names ideally start 3-digit number (###) since table levels (hence questionnare items ) always ordered according (alphabetical) order names: Deepest2 table level named item defines “atomic” questionnaire item (= single row Markdown questionnaires) template multiple similar “atomic” questionnaire items. can defined multiple times (item) must wrapped double brackets: Items appear final questionnaire order defined . Technically, level item array tables represented list unnamed lists R. Table levels top deepest level item can named anything except variable_name intended arrange /group items set keys hold multiple questionnaire items hierarchically order avoid redundancies. NOTE: still strongly discouraged name table levels keys listed .
code: [blockname] [blockname.00X_2nd_lvl.00X_3rd_lvl] [[blockname.00X_2nd_lvl.00X_3rd_lvl.item]]

title: FOKUS questionnaire schema
text: keys support glue’s string interpolation, meaning non-character-type keys like include variable_values can also specified string (arrays) automatically converted proper type questionnaire generation. specifically, keys hold arrays like response_options fed glue::glue() allowing use powerful string interpolation syntax, keys holding scalars like include fed cli::pluralize() additionally supports handy pluralization syntax. default behavior trimming surrounding whitespaces disabled cases. vary non-binary keys like topic, question etc. wordings different cantons /ballot dates directly without relying embedded R code, can define single-canton subkeys named lowercase English canton name (e.g. aargau) applying specific canton, single-date subkeys named YYYYMMDD (respective ballot date without -) applying specific ballot date, begin-end interval subkeys named YYYYMMDD_YYYYMMDD applying ballot dates fall specified interval, default applying canton ballot date specific subkey exists. Interval subkeys mustn’t overlap. Single-date subkeys precedence interval subkeys canton subkeys precedence date subkeys. vary binary keys like allow_multiple_answers include directly, can define begin-end interval subkeys described , alternatively subkeys named true (meaning inclusion) false (meaning exclusion; priority true case ambiguity) containing array cantons dates (YYYY-MM-DD), well default (applying cantons ballot dates included true false subkeys). true/false subkeys precedence begin-end interval subkeys. Subkey can combined nesting . vary keys different ballot types, just define subkeys named referendum election. Examples: NOTES: variable_name key mustn’t subkeys. variable_label_common explicitly defined, falls back variable_label.default. question_common explicitly defined, falls back ) question_full.default, b) question.default, c) question_full. keys lvl, j interpreted iterators can refer via string interpolation (e.g. voting_decision_{lvl}), define similar questionnaire items . evaluate NULL empty vector, respective item automatically excluded, .e. ’s necessary explicitly set include (sub)keys case. can even cross-reference keys non-parent nodes using qstnr_item_val(). careful create infinite loops via circular references. explicitly unset key, just assign string containing NA correct type wrapped curly braces ("{NA_character_}" values type string, "{NA_integer_}" values type integer etc.). constraint notice automatically added end variable_label variable_label_common possible (e.g. "blabla (non-voters)"). variable_label_common definition mustn’t vary time, must explicitly specified including constraint notice varies time. questionnaire complemented supplemental TOML file YYYY-MM-DD.toml ballot date holds additional date-specific metadata.

text: package borrows lot Tidyverse design philosophies. R code adheres principles specified Tidyverse Design Guide wherever possible formatted according Tidyverse Style Guide (TSG) following exceptions: Line width limited 160 characters, double limit proposed TSG (80 characters ridiculously little given today’s high-resolution wide screen monitors). Furthermore, preferred style breaking long lines differs. Instead wrapping directly expression’s opening bracket suggested TSG, prefer two fewer line breaks indent subsequent lines within expression opening bracket: results less vertical horizontal spread code better readability pipes. Usage magrittr’s compound assignment pipe-operator %<>% desirable2. Usage R’s right-hand assignment operator -> allowed3. R source code split several files suggested TSG instead (far possible) kept single file Rmd/fokus.Rmd well-structured thanks Markdown support. far possible, deviations TSG plus additional restrictions formally specified pkgpurl::default_linters, (default) used pkgpurl::lint_rmd(), turn recommended way lint package.

what: Backup Google Drive file locally — backup_g_file
title: Backup Google Drive file locally — backup_g_file
text: Creates local backup Google Drive file.

title: Backup Google Drive file locally — backup_g_file
code: backup_g_file(   g_id,   path,   type = NULL,   path_gcp_service_account_key = Sys.getenv("PATH_GCP_KEY_ZDA"),   overwrite = TRUE,   force = FALSE,   quiet = TRUE )

title: Backup Google Drive file locally — backup_g_file
text: g_id Google Drive file ID. character scalar. path Path local file backup destination. character scalar. type Desired type Google Drive file backed . consulted g_id identifies native Google Apps file. processed via googledrive::drive_mime_type(), can either file extension like "pdf", full MIME type like "application/pdf", NULL determine type based file extension path (none specified, falls back default type determined Google Drive API). Note type takes precedence possible file extension path, specifying latter normally suffice. path_gcp_service_account_key Path GCP Service Account Key JSON file. See auth_g_drive_gcp() details. overwrite Whether overwrite already existing file path. force Whether force overwriting file regardless whether changed since last backup . quiet Whether suppress printing status output googledrive operations.

title: Backup Google Drive file locally — backup_g_file
text: object class dribble, tibble one row per file local backup ()written, otherwise NULL, meaning remote file deviated local backup since last run, invisibly.

title: Backup Google Drive file locally — backup_g_file
text: Essentially convenience wrapper around googledrive::drive_download(). Google Sheet includes multiple worksheets backed file type support worksheets like "csv", default (first) worksheet written. contrast, backup_g_sheet() allows specify worksheet backed (always writes single worksheet regardless filetype).

title: Backup Google Sheet locally — backup_g_sheet
text: Creates local backup Google Sheet. accessed via googlesheets4::read_sheet() written via readr::write_csv() writexl::write_xlsx(), depending file extension path.

title: Backup Google Sheet locally — backup_g_sheet
code: backup_g_sheet(   g_id,   path,   ...,   path_gcp_service_account_key = Sys.getenv("PATH_GCP_KEY_ZDA"),   overwrite = TRUE,   force = FALSE,   quiet = TRUE )

title: Backup Google Sheet locally — backup_g_sheet
text: g_id Google Drive file ID. character scalar. path Path local file backup destination. character scalar. ... arguments passed googlesheets4::read_sheet(). path_gcp_service_account_key Path GCP Service Account Key JSON file. See auth_g_drive_gcp() details. overwrite Whether overwrite already existing file path. force Whether force overwriting file regardless whether changed since last backup . quiet Whether suppress printing status output googledrive googlesheets4 operations.

title: Backup Google Sheet locally — backup_g_sheet
text: tibble local backup ()written, otherwise NULL, meaning remote file deviated local backup since last run, invisibly.

title: Backup Google Sheet locally — backup_g_sheet
text: backup_g_sheet() backs single worksheet (specified optional sheet argument). intend backup multiple worksheets Google Sheet, consider using backup_g_file() combination file type supports multiple worksheets like "ods" "xlsx".

List columns expanded long format. Columns question_intro_i question_intro_j merged single column question_intro. Column question_full complemented, .e. made fall back question NA. Columns question_common variable_label_common complemented, .e. made fall back question_full variable_label respectively NA. Markdown formatting stripped character columns.

Das ist bei jemandem, der im Ausland wohnhaft ist, nicht der Fall." #>  #> [[2]]$de$short #> [1] "Im Ausland wohnhafte sind nicht mit den Gegebenheiten des Kantons vertraut" #>  #>  #> [[2]]$en #> [[2]]$en$long #> [1] "Anyone who can be elected to the Council of States should also be familiar with the circumstances of the canton. This is not the case for someone who lives abroad." #>  #>  #> [[2]]$nr #> [1] 1 #>  #> [[2]]$side #> [1] "contra" #>  #>  #> [[3]] #> [[3]]$de #> [[3]]$de$long #> [1] "Die Einführung des Ständeratswahlrechts für Auslandschweizer/innen ist gerechtfertigt, weil nur sehr geringe Mehrkosten entstehen." #>  #> [[3]]$de$short #> [1] "Mehrkosten sind sehr gering" #>  #>  #> [[3]]$en #> [[3]]$en$long #> [1] "The introduction of the right to elect members of the Council of States for Swiss citizens living abroad is justified because the additional costs are very low." #>  #>  #> [[3]]$nr #> [1] 2 #>  #> [[3]]$side #> [1] "pro" #>  #>  #> [[4]] #> [[4]]$de #> [[4]]$de$long #> [1] "Über kantonale Angelegenheiten sollen nur jene entscheiden dürfen, die auch von kantonalen Entscheiden betroffen sind. Das ist bei Schweizern und Schweizerinnen, die im Ausland wohnen, nicht der Fall." #>  #> [[4]]$de$short #> [1] "Nur direkt Betroffene sollen über kantonale Angelegenheiten entscheiden" #>  #>  #> [[4]]$en #> [[4]]$en$long #> [1] "Only those who are also affected by cantonal decisions should be allowed to decide on cantonal matters. what: Write file to private FOKUS repository — write_private_file

title: Write file to private FOKUS repository — write_private_file
text: path File path relative repository root. content File content, character scalar text files, raw vector binary files. path local file character scalar from_file = TRUE. from_file Whether content indicates path local file instead actual file content. overwrite Whether overwrite already existing file. commit_message Git commit message file creation/update. branch Git branch name upload file . auth_token Personal access token gitlab.com account access private FOKUS repository. quiet Whether suppress printing status output internal processing.
